title: Voyageurs National Park: Weather
body: Weather         A double rainbow over Voyageurs National Park after a summer storm. NPS  A Season for Everyone There are four distinct seasons in Voyageur country. The air is temperate during June, July, and August when periods of fine, mild weather prevail. The frost-free season averages 120 days from June to mid-September. The average ice-out date is May 3rd but varies year to year. Annual precipitation (rain and snow) averages 25-28 inches in the park and average snowfall ranges from 55-70 inches, but is highly variable. The first measurable snowfall occurs in late October and the last in late April or early May. The most up-to-date, local weather conditions and forecasts are available from the National Weather Service.      Average Temperature and Precipitation by Month     Month   Average Highs (ºF)   Average Lows (ºF)   Precipitation Average (Inches)    Jan 14 -8 0.84    Feb   22   -1   0.64     March   35   12   0.96     April   51   27   1.38     May   67   40   2.55     June   74   49   3.98     July   79   54   3.37     Aug   76   51   3.14     Sept   65   42   3.03     Oct   52   31   1.98     Nov   33   16   1.36     Dec   18   -1   0.7            Ice Conditions Ice up and ice out vary every year. Weather conditions such as air temperature, water temperature, wind, rain and snow can have great affects on how the ice freezes up in the fall and thaws in the spring. Please use caution at all times while traveling on the ice, but use extreme caution during the late fall and early spring when ice conditions can be unstable.    Lake Average Ice On Average Ice Out Early Ice Out Late Ice Out   Rainy December 9 May 3 April 6, 2012 May 22, 1950   Kabetogama November 28 April 28 April 1, 2012 May 18, 1996
